author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Tamil Nadu Village Assistants Association staging a stir in Pudukottai on Friday.

Members of the district wing of the Tamil Nadu Revenue Village Assistants’ Association staged a stir in front of the Public Office here on Friday in support of their demands.

Their demands, among other things, included posting of additional village assistants in commensurate with the workload in each and every village. They demanded special allowances for election duty.

Later, the association adopted a resolution urging the State government to recruit additional village assistants.

V. Chellaiah, district president of the association, said the strength of the village assistants across the state had come down from 33,000 to 14,000.

“With a good number of new taluks and new districts having been carved out in the past decades, the strength has come down, resulting in overloading of work on the existing staff,” he said.

He said that although the village assistants played a key role in the safe transit of the Electronic Voting machine during the election period, they were not eligible for any special allowances.

The association adopted a resolution urging the State government to sanction election duty allowances for the village assistants.
title: Village assistants protest
